abstract: There is a strong correlation between how often people search online for “estate agents” and actual house prices, two Bank of England researchers wrote in a report on Monday.
snippet: There is a strong correlation between how often people search online for “estate agents” and actual house prices, two Bank of England researchers wrote in a report on Monday.
lead_paragraph: The Bank of England has started to use Google search data to help it spot trends in Britain’s housing and labor markets.

headline.main: Using Google Searches to Track Housing Prices
